title: What trends are currently changing the hospitality industry? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my mind as a Front Office person, the biggest trend right now is the rise of the smartphone as a rooms tool. All of the major flags have mobile check-in and check-out apps, and Starwood is in the early stages of rolling out an app that can function as a room key. Hilton's app removes the power from the Front Desk to the point that you can pick your room. This displeases me on several levels, but that's outside the scope of the question.  Another thing to look out for is the rise in adaptive reuse. Hotel developers are making good use of buildings that were not originally intended as hotels. Trump's use of the Old Post Office Building in DC and Kimpton's purchase of the old Family Court in Philadelphia are wonderful examples of this.  The industry is also shifting from Baby Boomers as a majority source of income. The shift is toward Millennials, which is why you're seeing more open lobbies with insane numbers of power outlets, along with hotels discovering the craft beer industry and shying away from the bigger names. Room service as the prior generation knew it is dying in favor of prepared grab-and-go, and I just read an article in HOTELS Magazine this morning which said that more restaurant menus are getting priced and written with sharing in mind.  Despite the Cornell University study which said that green attributes are revenue-neutral and possibly a slight loser of money, the environmental sensitivity trend will continue unabated. To that end, you will see more and more hotels doing things like rooftop gardens - any item that a hotel can source without a truck having to drop it off is an addition to the hotel's story for the marketers to tell and almost certainly a long-term cost saver.  In short: mobile, grab-and-go, lobbies, and environmentally inspired storytelling.

Trends In Hospitality Industry  A hotel is a place that helps people connect and experience local culture, where guests can relax, eat, sleep, celebrate, relax, and be entertained. 1.Role of Technology in the Hospitality Industry: A hotel is a place that helps people connect and experience local culture, where guests can relax, eat, sleep, celebrate, relax, and be entertained. To give guests what they need, hotels need to have both technological and physical infrastructures. Today, even with the advancement in the tools, the hospitality industry still sees technology gaps. The hospitality industry faces an inherent challenge that slows down technology adoption and innovation. Some of the difficulties include hotels brands not facilitating technology rollout and sticking to antiquated legacy technology systems, low margins, and high technology deployment costs. Thoughtful adoption of technology can perk up guest experiences and keep pace with the varying culture and business environment. The three critical areas of technology in hospitality are: The Design of Intelligent Buildings In the present day, hotel buildings are becoming smart. The process of making the building intelligent starts right through its design and construction, along with the preference of technology-ready green building features and systems. Additionally, the process continues with incorporating the Operating System (OS) for the structure to make sure that software and systems are run together. Point-of-sale, property management, labor-management tools, accounting software, point-of-sale are some of the technologies to be integrated into the OS. Task management system advances the activities like prioritizing maintenance and housekeeping, layering guest check-ins, and check-outs to maximize revenue and labor productivity in a fully integrated smart hotel. The process enables visitor customization choices and mechanizes accounting and reporting. The phases; design and integration are well in progress, in particular for large-scale developments and renovation where businesses have prioritized technology update as their business strategy. The last segment involves the integration of business intelligence and analytics that evaluate the guest’s online activity before and after their stay. The tool helps hotels understand: • The guest behavior, chiefly when used in union with data on what the guests did during the visit.• Hotels can track where guests go out for dinner and gain perspective on why they did not select the property’s restaurant.• The movement of visitors in a convention hotel to enhance retail locations in the building.• The habits of repeat visitors to offer them the right room temperature and other amenities on their next visit in a hotel of the brand. Moreover, privacy and cybersecurity are key reasons that have slowed the deployment of tracking technologies.   Photo by Yingchih on Unsplash Employment of Big Data and Artificial Intelligence (AI) The utilization of AI in the hotel industry is primarily centered on consumer services, through recommendation chatbots and engines. AI is not a uniformed platform that is applied to only one particular area of the hospitality industry, but is increasingly organized in several ways. Revenue management can become an ever more tactical part of hotel operations. The capability to examine data sets on factors such as behavior, guest segmentation, event information, and weather patterns will help inform analytical yield management systems. Besides, information from digital interactions and on-property behavior will improve the operation of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and loyalty tools. The enhancement also allows hospitality firms to foster loyalty, capitalize on brand advocacy, and deliver an understanding of the travelers’ aspirations and needs. Furthermore, AI-driven systems have the potential to upgrade identification and face recognition software to make the check-in and check-out process more secure and authorize access to restricted areas and rooms. Additionally, the technology can also help the hospitality industry to filter and recruit candidates to increase the productivity given the labor-intensive nature of the industry and the major turnover issue. Virtual travel assistants and chatbots can assist the sector spontaneously as they become more visible along with delivering tasks like ordering room service and getting data on the flight. In addition, technology is growing to become a virtual assistant that concierges with the guest’s journey like ordering tickets for a show, recommending a restaurant in the town. Introduction of Robotics to Ease Labor Cost Pressures Subject to segments and markets hotels operate in, most analysis on proprietary data shows that payroll and benefits correspond to 15–40% of the hotel revenue. From increased labor costs to jobs that are improbable to outsource or move toward affordable labor markets, hospitality is facing a significant issue that can be mitigated by automation. The way factories and households are being automated by the incorporation of robots to perform chores; hotels can similarly be automated from housekeeping to front desk. Technology is poised to change hotel labor with robot room-service delivery, self-check-in kiosks, and optimized precautionary maintenance approaches that decrease the need for human intervention. Also, with automation comes the need to connect with the hotel unions and employees proactively. Hospitality firms ought to have stronger bonds with the associations, giving them a place at the table to make sure the interest of the employees is kept at the center of the process. The Need of Automation Intrinsically, hospitality industry is a business focusing on being hospitable. So, the technology in the industry is meant to make hotels safer, environment-friendly, and profitable while improving the customer experience and not replacing it. In essence, technology deployment should free up hotel associates from the mundane tasks, so that they can focus on the value-add actions. If hotels employ AI, data analysis, and other technologies, then employees can focus on the guest-facing interactions, thereby creating a memorable visitor experience. Lastly, technology should be viewed as a social human interaction tool and a complementary operational strategy to remain at the core of the business to offer customized experience and an exceptional service. Source Link: Travel and Hospitality Tech Outlook

As the technologies around us are growing day by day, people love to stay update in everything.  In the hospitality industry, the current trends are using mobiles as a room tool, use of AI, use of advanced technologies, sustainability and the usage of self-service kiosks. People are started using check-ins and check-outs from mobile. They can use their mobile phones to check the availability of rooms from anywhere. It eliminates the need of waiting for the front desk operations. Also, with the usage of self-service kiosks in many hotels people check-in and check-out very easily. So staffs are engaged in customer value added services. Serving your customer in a friendly way makes a memorable experience for them. It adds value to your industry. Moreover it increases the customer satisfaction. Increasingly, customers are concerned with environmental issues and want to know that the businesses they deal with are behaving environment friendly. For this reason, sustainability has been one of the most noticeable hospitality trends in recent times. PMS software system in hotel enables to take care of rate management tasks and revenue operations effectively. It promotes an online booking engine where you can easily reserve rooms via the website or social media and make online payments.There are different types of hotel management software like clovatel, hotelogiz, cloudbeds etc… PMS enhances your experience by providing the smartest hotel app to you. This app makes you control your room via a mobile like switching on TV or AC before entering into the room. Hope this information is helpful.

With the ongoing pandemic leaving deeper scars in terms of occupancy rates hitting single digits, airline travel pulled down by an astounding 90+ per cent, and an all-time low economy slowdown that could tighten financial screws, is it the end of the road to recovery as predicted by industry pundits? Traditional hotels including boutique and small hotels should look beyond than just executing transactional, process-centric actions when adopting digital technologies such as AR/VR, AI/ML, Big Data, Analytics, Robotics, Deep Learning, Air Microbial tech, just to name a few. Wide-scale business transformation will guarantee its staying ahead of the competitive curve, creating service differentiation, thereby spurring it to take swift and decisive action, even as the potential scale and outcome of the pandemic may continue to spell uncertainty. On the flip side, as Laura Wolinsky, director at Kroll Bond Rating Agency, says “it’s going to be a slow crawl back to normalcy for traditional hotels.”

Hi, Hospitality industry is diverse and includes a variety of services from check-in, accommodation, restaurant services, and travel agents. Day by day, the customers are changing their behavior according to the latest innovations. Hence, it is essential for business owners to update to the latest trends in the world. Because of the pandemic spread of the COVID- 19, people fear of the spread of the virus. Hence, it is very important that a hotel owner should take the preventive measures. Hoteliers should provide sanitizers and adopt temperature detector system for the guests. Many customers feel uncomfortable to handle the cash and make payments for the services. Many of the big hospitality industries adopt contactless payments in their organization. It also helps to save time for the customers. With the help of a self-service kiosk, customers can even make payments. It eliminates the chances of spreading infections around them. Also, with the help of a self-service kiosk, guests can check-in, check-out, and print receipts for the payments. The functionalities of a kiosk improve customer experience and also help hotel staffs to focus more on the guest services. Today’s generation especially the young travelers prefer to enjoy the latest trends and offers in any public places. So, it is a great opportunity for hoteliers. With the help of a kiosk, hoteliers can easily upsell a product or service. It continuously promotes the available promotions, offers and helps guests to choose an offer. Whereas, these tactics could not be achieved with the help of a manual system. These are the recent trends in hospitality industry that drives more customers to the hospitality environment. Thank you for reading.

The automatic Digital Restaurant Menu definitely will change the current trend of managing the restaurant business. It will improve the existing systems of ordering and paying for diners that will enhance their restaurant dining experience.  Some of the services that will be improved with the implementation of Digital Restaurant Menu App is menu flexibility. This will allow managers to eliminate the traditional system of menu reprints and eliminate the inconvenience time.  Broadcasting messages has become simple for managers. Sharing special dishes or any upcoming special events is now easy and quick for managers. With enhanced services of Restaurant eMenu, the hospitality sector will be highly improved.
